<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 2"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Assured Identification](/Feats.aspx?ID=2111) <actions string="" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="General" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=78" />
<trait label="Skill" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=144" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Advanced Player's Guide](/Sources.aspx?ID=39) pg. 203 <sup>2.0</sup></row>

**Prerequisites**
Expert in [Arcana](/Skills.aspx?ID=2), Expert in [Nature](/Skills.aspx?ID=10), Expert in [Occultism](/Skills.aspx?ID=11), or Expert in [Religion](/Skills.aspx?ID=13)

</column>

---

You rarely misidentify an item. When using [Arcana](/Skills.aspx?ID=2), [Nature](/Domains.aspx?ID=22), [Occultism](/Skills.aspx?ID=11), or [Religion](/Skills.aspx?ID=13) checks to [Identify Magic](/Actions.aspx?ID=24), if you roll a critical failure, you get a failure instead. If you would [misidentify a cursed item because you roll a success but not a critical success](/Rules.aspx?ID=1094), you simply can't identify it instead.

prerequisite: Expert in Arcana, Expert in Nature, Expert in Occultism, or Expert in Religion
